util

Class RemoteObjFactoryImpl

  • java.lang.Object
    • util.RemoteObjFactoryImpl
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Exporter, Importer, RemoteObjFactory

    final class RemoteObjFactoryImpl
extends java.lang.Object
implements RemoteObjFactory
    Class responsible for figuring out object type, generating references and inserting the objects into the exported objects store.
    See Also:
    RemoteObj, DistObjManager

    • Constructor Detail

      • RemoteObjFactoryImpl

        RemoteObjFactoryImpl(io.atomix.catalyst.transport.Address address,
                     io.atomix.catalyst.transport.Transport t,
                     java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.util.Map<java.lang.Long,java.lang.Object>> objstr)
        RemoteObjFactoryImpl needs to know the address in which it is operating to assign to references it generates. Needs the underlying store reference to populate with exported objects.
        Parameters:
        address - The network address of the process's DistObjManager.
        t - the transport in which the client connection is established.
        objstr - The object store of the DistObjManager.
        See Also:
        DistObjManager

    • Method Detail

      • importRef

        public java.util.Optional<? extends Stub> importRef(RemoteObj b)
        Imports a stub from a given remote object.

        Stubs are infused with the calling processes network info, in order to delegate actual method invocations through RMI transparently.

        Specified by:
        importRef in interface Importer
        Parameters:
        b - The object reference
        Returns:
        A stub or empty (in case of invalid class -> should never happen)
        See Also:
        RemoteObj

      • exportRef

        public java.util.Optional<RemoteObj> exportRef(java.lang.Object b)
        Description copied from interface: Exporter
        Export a RemoteObj from an Object instance.
        Specified by:
        exportRef in interface Exporter
        Parameters:
        b - the Object from which to generate the remote reference.
        Returns:
        An optional remote reference
        See Also:
        RemoteObj
